special_abilities.name: Undead Nature.
descriptions: A death knight doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance.
descriptions: The death knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Marshal Undead.
descriptions: Unless the death knight is incapacitated, it and undead creatures of its choice within 60 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against features that turn undead.

special_abilities.name: Spellcasting.
descriptions: The death knight is a 19th-level spell caster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

descriptions.raw: 1st level (4 slots): command, compelled duel, searing smite
descriptions.hyperlinked: 1st level (4 slots): command, compelled duel, searing smite

descriptions.raw: 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, magic weapon
descriptions.hyperlinked: 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, magic weapon

descriptions.raw: 3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, elemental weapon
descriptions.hyperlinked: 3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, elemental weapon

actions.name: Multiattack.
descriptions: The death knight makes three longsword attacks.

actions.name: Longsword.
descriptions: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage, or 10 (1d10 + 5) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 18 (4d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Hellfire Orb (1/day).
descriptions: The death knight hurls a magical ball of fire that explodes at a point it can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 35 (10d6) fire damage and 35 (10d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Parry.
descriptions: The death knight adds 6 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the death knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.
